instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Liquid damage declared but logic board is immaculate.
Trackpad circuitboard badly corroded. Trackpad replaced, trackpad flex cable replaced.
Some keys dont work, some keys return the wrong character.
A replacement <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard produces exact same result although an external keyboard works fine.
What would be the next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Keyboard information is encoded into trackpad circuitry.
J6700 can't cause this issue.
Should be a problem with keyboard itself, or its connection to trackpad board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Thank you! That will teach me never to purchase second hand trackpads. I just took out a corroded one to replace with a faulty one.
